info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 1:50AM EDT until May 06 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Jackson County in western North Carolina... Northeastern Swain County in western North Carolina... Northwestern Haywood County in western North Carolina... * Until 230 AM EDT. * At 150 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Bryson City, or near Smoky Mountains-Oconaluftee, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Cherokee, Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee, Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain, Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, Smoky Mountains-Oconaluftee, Waterville, Fines Creek, Whittier and Cove Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
